page.title: 12Holy Cross Church Binstead
page.content: The church has about 200 members. It is situated near the the sea, some distance from the village. It was originally built to serve the community employed in the{limestone {quarries or "pitts"}as they were known locally. Very little of the original building remains. The Chancel wall has an ancient scratch-dial and herringbone stonework of the early{Norman}period. The Nave dates from the 19th century. Much of the church was restored after a fire in 1969. The most interesting grave in the churchyard is that of{Thomas Sivell and is mistakenly known as the {"Smuggler's grave".}Sivell was not a smuggler but was shot in error by customs officers from Portsmouth on 15th June 1785. The head stone has a sculptured scene of the incident.
